intro: Verbesina caymanensis, commonly known as Cayman gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, contributing to its resilience in coastal environments.
